pullRequest.body:
We introduce the notations `Œ± ‚â§i Œ≤` and `Œ± <i Œ≤` for initial/principal segment embeddings between the `<` relations of two types. We also prove a few lemmas.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9bab8a49c0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17481/commits/9bab8a49c0260bb815069ca4549804e399f547de)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_toOrderEmbedding`
`+ instance [PartialOrder Œ±] [PartialOrder Œ≤] : OrderHomClass (Œ± ‚â§i Œ≤) Œ± Œ≤`
`+ toOrderEmbedding`
`+ toOrderEmbedding_apply`
`++ le_apply_iff`
`++ le_iff_le`
`++ lt_apply_iff`
`++ lt_iff_lt`
`++ mem_range_of_le`
`++ monotone`
`++ strictMono`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Sorry, I see I commented on the wrong PR. See the dependent PR.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
lgtm, ping me once the merge conflict is fixed and I'll hit merge
I think it should be fixed now, but let's wait for CI just in case.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11273072290/job/31349302048)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11273072290/job/31349302228)

Thanks!

bors merge
maintainer merge

Thanks!

bors merge

Why make it an abbrev?
```suggestion
/-- An `InitialSeg` between the `<` relations of two types. -/
notation:25 alpha:24 " ‚â§i " beta:25 => @InitialSegLT Œ± Œ≤ (¬∑ < ¬∑) (¬∑ < ¬∑)
```
or something like that
Nice! I'm not really familiar with the `notation` syntax, but this is much cleaner.

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast]
```
"badly shaped lemma, rhs can't start with coe"
Can you check gcongr proves the <- direction? If it doesn't, you might need to add an `OrderHomClass` instance

I added the `OrderHomClass` instance, but this still makes no progress:
```lean 4
example [PartialOrder Œ±] (f : Œ± ‚â§i Œ≤) (h : a ‚â§ a') : f a ‚â§ f a' := by gcongr
```
How old is your master? I added the gcongr lemma a few days ago
Did you happen to add it in #17224? Because that PR is open :P
Ah damn!
Can you discuss in the module doc why this pair of notations makes sense for initial and principal segments?
I just kinda came up with it. My reasoning is that `‚âº` and `‚â∫` refer to "general" relations, while `‚â§` and `<` are linked to the order typeclass hierarchy.
Sure, but why is "initial segment" the non-strict version of "principal segment"?
Because of [`InitialSeg.ltOrEq`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/InitialSeg.html#InitialSeg.ltOrEq). Do I link that lemma in this notation section?
I've added a small comment referring to this theorem.
This note still applies, I'm pretty sure
Is it still useful though? As I understand, the notation should be scoped even without this.
What makes you think the notation is currently scoped?
I recall having to open the namespace to have this notation work. If it's not scoped, should it be?
It doesn't seem scoped to me at all. I don't know whether it should be, but certainly it's out of scope (ü•Å) to scope it or to remove the porting in this PR
I'd hope simps can make this automatically...?

It doesn't seem to work for whatever reason. Gives the following error:
```txt
Invalid simp lemma InitialSeg.toOrderEmbedding_apply.
The given definition is not a constructor application:
  f.toRelEmbedding.1
```
as before
In the general (not-partial-order) case, we also have RelHomClass here, right?
Yep, I've opened #17598 where I add this alongside some missing instances on `PrincipalSeg`.
Seems like this and the below should all follow nicely if we had RelEmbeddingClass... Let's add a TODO to this effect
Don't you want all the le_iff_le; lt_iff_lt lemmas here too?
Nice catch! Yeah, I forgot about these. Fortunately it's just a bunch of one liners, so I'll bunch all of these theorems together at the end of the file.

```suggestion
-- Porting note: Deleted `scoped[InitialSeg]`
```
very minor but I think this might make git assign the blame for this line correctly

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/InitSeg): notation for initial and principal segments of `<`
